announcements.title: âš ï¸ Wake-up Feature Risk Notice
announcements.summary: Plugin wake-up has risk-control risk (Cloud Code direct calls). We recommend switching to Cockpit Tools desktop.
announcements.content:
Plugin wake-up has risk-control risk (Cloud Code direct calls).
We recommend using Cockpit Tools desktop first (same link path as the official client).

Plugin wake-up currently uses Cloud Code direct calls for conversation wake-up. Google has recently tightened risk controls for this behavior. In theory, low-frequency wake-up is unlikely to trigger risk control, but you still need to understand and evaluate the risk yourself.

Cockpit Tools desktop uses "Local Gateway + Official Language Server Protocol" (StartCascade / SendUserCascadeMessage / GetCascadeTrajectory / DeleteCascadeTrajectory). The link is consistent with the official client, with theoretically lower risk and better stability.
It also supports batch account verification (such as 403 scenarios), wake-up task management, and the latest Gemini 3.1 Pro related models.

New wake-up capabilities require Cockpit Tools desktop v0.9.0 or later.
Click the button below to open the Cockpit Tools download page (latest version recommended).

We recommend switching to Cockpit Tools desktop.

en.title: âš ï¸ Wake-up Feature Risk Notice
en.summary: Plugin wake-up has risk-control risk (Cloud Code direct calls). We recommend switching to Cockpit Tools desktop.
en.content:
Plugin wake-up has risk-control risk (Cloud Code direct calls).
We recommend using Cockpit Tools desktop first (same link path as the official client).

Plugin wake-up currently uses Cloud Code direct calls for conversation wake-up. Google has recently tightened risk controls for this behavior. In theory, low-frequency wake-up is unlikely to trigger risk control, but you still need to understand and evaluate the risk yourself.

Cockpit Tools desktop uses "Local Gateway + Official Language Server Protocol" (StartCascade / SendUserCascadeMessage / GetCascadeTrajectory / DeleteCascadeTrajectory). The link is consistent with the official client, with theoretically lower risk and better stability.
It also supports batch account verification (such as 403 scenarios), wake-up task management, and the latest Gemini 3.1 Pro related models.

New wake-up capabilities require Cockpit Tools desktop v0.9.0 or later.
Click the button below to open the Cockpit Tools download page (latest version recommended).

We recommend switching to Cockpit Tools desktop.
